ch.aplu.util

Class ButtonEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.util.EntryItem
      • ch.aplu.util.ButtonEntry

  • public class ButtonEntry
extends EntryItem
    Class derived from EntryItem to create a push button in a EntryDialog. Buttons are displayed horizontally and center aligned in the EntryPane.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ButtonEntry(java.lang.String text)
      Creates a push button with given button text.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.swing.JButton getButton()
      Returns the underlaying JButton.
      boolean getValue()
      Returns the current state of the button.
      boolean isTouched()
      Returns true, if the button was hit by the mouse until the last call if this method.
      void setEnabled(boolean enable)
      Enable/disable the button.

    • Method Detail

      • getButton

        public javax.swing.JButton getButton()
        Returns the underlaying JButton.
        Returns:
        the JButton reference

      • getValue

        public boolean getValue()
        Returns the current state of the button.
        Returns:
        true, if the button is pressed; otherwise false

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable the button.

      • isTouched

        public boolean isTouched()
        Returns true, if the button was hit by the mouse until the last call if this method. Any further call will return false, until the button is hit again. Puts calling thread to sleep for 1 millisecond, so it can be used in a tight polling loop.
        Returns:
        true, if the button was hit since the last call
